intro: Jumellea rutenbergiana, commonly known as the Rutenberg's jumellea, is a rare and striking plant native to the arid regions of Israel. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow and orange, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Jumellea rutenbergiana is considered a species of conservation concern.
